arm_group.description: Amputee with one arm or one leg amputated/ Far infrared ray to the phantom limb site
Healthy subjects under 30 years old/ Far infrared ray to the sole

brief_summary.textblock:
With the far infrared ray applied to the 'phantom limbs' in amputees and the corresponding
      normal legs in healthy subjects, the sensation of (phantom) limb will be assessed for each
      subject using the techniques of fMRI and meridian response.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Origin of Phantom Limb Sensation and Phantom Limb Pain in Amputees

detailed_description.textblock:
This project will investigate two main hypotheses based on our previous studies on phantom
      limb sensation and phantom limb pain. The first hypothesis states that phantom limb
      sensation and phantom limb pain both correlate with the 'phantom limb', while the second one
      maintains that the phantom limb can interact with the patient's body by means of the
      meridian system. With the far infrared ray applied to the 'phantom limbs' in amputees and
      the corresponding normal legs in healthy subjects, the sensation of (phantom) limb will be
      assessed for each subject using the techniques of fMRI and meridian response. By analyzing
      the data collected from both groups, the investigators expect both hypotheses will be
      supported by the results of experiments in this project.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Amputees: at least one arm or one leg amputated

          -  Healthy subjects: healthy person under 30 years old

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  with mental diseases

intervention.description: exposure 40-minute far infrared ray to the sole for each person/amputee.
intervention.intervention_name: Far infrared ray to the sole

facility.name: NTUH department of orthopedics; NTU department of electrical engneering

clinical_study.official_title: The Origin of Phantom Limb Sensation and Phantom Limb Pain in Amputees

primary_outcome.description: The resting fMRI images will be obtained before and after the far infrared exposed to the phantom limb site. The default mode of the brain will be analyzed. If the default mode was changed, it was one of the evidence that the neural signal was transmitted from the phantom limb site into the brain and caused the change.
